A 40 year old male from bihar developed muscular rigidity, weakness and difficulty in walking. Subsequently he developed paralysis of lower limbs. His vitals are normal. On examination his ankle jerk and knee jerk are exaggerated. He gave history of khesari dal consumption. Which of the following toxin is responsible for this disease?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • (B) Sanguinarine Sanguinarine is an alkaloid toxin found in certain plants like Argemone mexicana. It is responsible for epidemic dropsy, a condition caused by contaminated mustard oil, leading to pitting edema, cardiovascular complications, and gastroenteritis, but not spastic paralysis.
  • • (C) Pyrrolizidine Pyrrolizidine alkaloids are hepatotoxic compounds found in plants like Crotalaria, Senecio, and Heliotropium. They cause liver damage (hepatic veno-occlusive disease) and cirrhosis, but not neurolathyrism.
  • • (D) Aflatoxin Aflatoxins are fungal toxins produced by Aspergillus flavus and Aspergillus parasiticus, commonly found in contaminated grains, nuts, and maize. They are highly hepatotoxic and carcinogenic, leading to acute liver failure and hepatocellular carcinoma, but not neurological symptoms.

BMI of 6 patients is given as 32.2 kg/cm2 , 35.6 kg/cm2 , 35.6 kg/cm2 , 52.4 kg/cm2 , 37.2 kg/cm2 and 41.0 kg/cm2 . Which of the following can’t be expected from this data while measuring central tendency?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a positive skewed data i.e. mean>median>mode

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The given BMI values are:
  • • 32.2, 35.6, 35.6, 52.4, 37.2, 41.0
  • • Step 1: Arranging the data in ascending order:
  • • 32.2, 35.6, 35.6, 37.2, 41.0, 52.4
  • • Step 2: Finding the Median
  • • • The median is the middle value in an ordered dataset.
  • • • Since there are 6 values (even number of observations), the median is the average of the 3rd and 4th values:
  • • Median= 35.6+37.2/2
  • • = 72.8/2
  • • = 36.4 kg/m 2
  • • The correct median is 36.4 kg/m 2 not 35.6 kg/m 2 , so option B is incorrect (making it the correct answer to the question).
  • • Explanation for the Other Options:
  • • A. It is a positively skewed data (Mean > Median > Mode) – Correct
  • • • The presence of 52.4 kg/m 2 (a high outlier) skews the data to the right, creating a positive skew.
  • • • In positively skewed data:
  • • - Mean > Median > Mode, which is true in this case.
  • • • So, option A is correct.
  • • C. Mode is 35.6 kg/m 2 – Correct
  • • • Mode is the most frequently occurring value in the dataset.
  • • • Since 35.6 kg/m 2 appears twice, it is the mode.
  • • • So, option C is correct.
  • • D. Mean is 39 kg/m 2 – Correct
  • • • Mean is calculated as
  • • Mean= 32.2+35.6+35.6+37.2+41.0+52.4/6
  • • = 234/6
  • • =39 kg/m 2

options.text: Only unvaccinated hospital residents and staff during an influenza A outbreak

options.label: D
options.text: Only unvaccinated hospital residents and staff during an influenza B outbreak

questions.correct_answer: A. All hospital residents and unvaccinated staff during an influenza A outbreak

questions.text: Mother of a 10-month-old unvaccinated child has brought her child to the PHC she complains that the child is vomiting and having profuse diarrhea for the last 24 hours. He has a temperature of 100°F and has signs of dehydration. No other person in the household is ill. The most likely etiologic agent responsible for the clinical syndrome is
Match each group of diseases with the most common described mode of transmission.
Match the following

A 28 year old travel blogger presents to you for taking an advice and tells you that he is planning a short trip to an area which is known to be malaria endemic. Which is the most appropriate intervention for malaria prophylaxis for this patient?
If rapidly progressive cancers are missed by a screening test, which type of bias will occur?

A 32 year old male presents to the casualty at 3:00 am with complaints of nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. He has no fever. Patient gives a history that he attended a marriage party where he had dinner at approx 9:00 pm eating chicken curry, salad and rasgulla for desert. Prevention of this food-borne illness could have been achieved by which of the following measures ?

options.label: C
options.text: Proper hand washing by food handlers

questions.correct_answer: C. Proper hand washing by food handlers

questions.text: A 48 year old male presents to the clinic with complaint of progressive nonproductive cough and dyspnea. He has no fever or weight loss. The complete blood count is normal. Patient has a long history of working in the mining industry. The chest x-ray is as follows. Patient is at risk of developing which of the following diseases ?
Lead toxicity is an important environmental disease and its effects on the human body are devastating. The major environmental source of lead absorbed in the human blood stream in adults is ?

A 24 year old college student with his group is planning a biking trip to laddkah after their exams, all of them are in good health. They will be riding through the “Khardung-la pass” which is at an elevation of 17,582 ft. When passing through the highest point this patient is at highest risk of developing

options.label: C
options.text: Headache, ataxia, and altered mental status

questions.correct_answer: A. Headache, nausea, and sleep disturbances

questions.text: The community medicine department of your medical college is conducting a research to study relationship between occupational exposure to different substances and development of cancer. In the study which of the following diseases is likely to be found almost exclusively among persons who have worked with or have been exposed to asbestos?

You are part of a medical team conducting health camps at industrial area of your district, a 53 year old worker presents to you for wellness checkup, he gives a history of working in dye industry for long time. Which of the following tests would be appropriate in this setting?

A couple married 4 years ago presents to the infertility clinic complaining inability to conceive, an elaborate history has been taken and investigations are done. The semen analysis of the male partner reveals oligospermia. Patient works in an industry which manufactures electrical batteries. Based on histroy the physician orders a blood test to specifically screen for which of the following substance ?

An explosion occurs in a unit of a chemical factory, because of maintenance purposes that particular unit where explosion occurred was closed and no workers got physical injury, but the workers in the nearby unit were exposed to sound of the explosion. The sound pressure levels ranged to the level of 190dB. Which of the following is the most likely outcome for these workers?
Hard water contains salts of calcium and magnesium, hard water consumption is associated with which of the following beneficial health effects?

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased incidence of osteoporosis in elderly females

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in cases of food poisoning

questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased incidence of cardiovascular disease

questions.text: Match the following clinical presentations with the most likely metal exposure.
Match each of the workers below with the infectious disease for which they are at risk.

In a nuclear power plant an accidental radiation leakage occurred, workers were exposed to 300 rem of radiation. Immediate upon detection the workers are sent to the hospital where a thorough workup of the patients is done. Considering the amount of radiation exposure which of the following effects will most likely occur among the majority of these workers?

options.label: C
options.text: No complaints as the radiation exposure is minimal

questions.text: On a hot summer day, a farm labourer is brought to the casualty room with complaint of blurred vision, salivation, nausea and vomiting. The labourer was involved in farm work of irrigation and spraying since morning. On examination heart rate and respiration is 50 and 20 per minute respectively along with perspiration and miosis. Among the given options which is the most effective initial intervention for this farm worker ?
Consider the distribution curve given below. Which of the following statement best applies to this curve?

options.label: A
options.text: The mean is a more robust measure of central tendency

options.label: C
options.text: The data is skewed to the right

options.label: D
options.text: The median is larger than the mean

questions.correct_answer: D. The median is larger than the mean

questions.text: A cancer research institution has conducted a research to study the mortality benefits of an intervention. The results of two intervention studies are given below. What is the most useful measure of association in assessing the clinical relevance of these two studies?
